column3: School of Policy and Global Affairs
column5: Key informationGain vital quantitative and analytical competencies demanded for major decision-making roles in the healthcare sectors of developed and developing countries. Covering topics from economic evaluation and quantitative methods to welfare economics and epidemiology, this course enables you to pursue a rewarding career in health economics.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
column9: 1 year full time, 27 months part time
